meanings.sent1: The cobbled street was bumpy under my feet.
meanings.sent2: The old town had charming cobbled pathways.
meanings.sent3: The cobbled road made the bicycle ride feel like a rollercoaster.
meanings.sent4: Her cobbled together outfit was a mix of colors and patterns.
meanings.sent5: The cobbled courtyard echoed with the sound of footsteps.

meanings.definition: Made or repaired in a rough or makeshift way.
meanings.sent1: He cobbled together a solution using duct tape.
meanings.sent2: The cobbled chair wobbled when sat upon.
meanings.sent3: The cobbled fence looked like it might fall over any moment.
meanings.sent4: The cobbled repair job held up surprisingly well.
meanings.sent5: The cobbled roof leaked whenever it rained.
